intro: Landolphia humilis, commonly known as the lesser arrowroot or African arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of yellowish-green flowers followed by distinctive, spiny fruits containing kidney-shaped seeds. It is often found in moist, wooded areas and is adapted to thrive in humid, tropical climates. Landolphia humilis is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in some African cultures.
